com.gnahraf.io.store.karoon.merge

Class GenerationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.store.karoon.merge.GenerationInfo

  • public final class GenerationInfo
extends Object
    A generation of source tables suitable for merging. Used for deciding which tables to merge.
    Author:
    Babak

      Returns the cumulative byte size of the sources for the merge.

    • Method Detail

      • cumulativeSourceSize

        public long cumulativeSourceSize()
        Returns the cumulative byte size of the sources for the merge.

      • effectToBytesRatio

        public double effectToBytesRatio()
        Returns a benefit to cost ratio, calculated as the number of table files reduced as a result of the merge operation, divided by the cumulative byte size of the sources for the merge.
        Returns:
        ((double) srcInfos.size() - 1) / cumulativeSourceSize()

      • reduceBy

        public GenerationInfo reduceBy(GenerationInfo pg)
                        throws HistoryException
        Parameters:
        pg - a prior run's generation info. Must be of the same generation as this instance.
        Returns:
        this instance, if pg is orthogonal to this instance (its doesn't overlap with this instance's srcIds()); a reduced instance, if pg's sources overlap this instance but leave at least 2 contiguous sources to merge; or null, o.w.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if pg's generation doesn't match this instance's
        HistoryException - if pg's history or state (e.g. if it only partially overlaps this instance)

      • generationalMergeCandidates

        public static List<GenerationInfo> generationalMergeCandidates(List<TableInfo> tableStack,
                                               MergePolicy mergePolicy)
        Returns a possibly empty list of candidate merges in ascending generation order from the given tableStack starting from the first generation. (The zeroth generation is the fresh meat generation which is typically specially handled.) The returned list, if not empty, is mutable.

        This is just shorthand for mergeCandidates(tableStack, mergePolicy, 1).

        Parameters:
        tableStack - list of tables in increasing order of precedence. The given list must not be modified; o.w. results are undefined.
        mergePolicy - used to determine generational size boundaries

      • candidateMerge

        public static GenerationInfo candidateMerge(List<TableInfo> tableStack,
                            MergePolicy mergePolicy,
                            int g)
        Returns a candidate merge for the specified generation g, or null if there's nothing to merge.

        This is just shorthand for candidateMerges(tableStack, mergePolicy, g, g + 1).

        Parameters:
        tableStack - list of tables in increasing order of precedence. The given list must not be modified; o.w. results are undefined.
        mergePolicy - used to determine generational size boundaries
        g - the generation number of the returned merge candidate

      • candidateMerges

        public static List<GenerationInfo> candidateMerges(List<TableInfo> tableStack,
                                   MergePolicy mergePolicy,
                                   int minGeneration)
        Returns a possibly empty list of candidate merges in ascending generation order from the given tableStack. The returned list, if not empty, is mutable.
        Parameters:
        minGeneration - the minimum generation of the returned merge candidates
        tableStack - list of tables in increasing order of precedence. The given list must not be modified; o.w. results are undefined.
        mergePolicy - used to determine generational size boundaries
        Returns:
        a (possibly empty) list of candidate merges in ascending generation order

      • candidateMerges

        public static List<GenerationInfo> candidateMerges(List<TableInfo> tableStack,
                                   MergePolicy mergePolicy,
                                   int minGeneration,
                                   int maxGeneration)
        Returns a possibly empty list of candidate merges in ascending generation order from the given tableStack. The returned list, if not empty, is mutable.
        Parameters:
        tableStack - list of tables in increasing order of precedence. The given list must not be modified; o.w. results are undefined.
        mergePolicy - used to determine generational size boundaries
        minGeneration - the minimum generation of the returned merge candidates (inclusive)
        maxGeneration - the maximum generation of the returned merge candidates (exclusive)
        Returns:
        a (possibly empty) list of candidate merges in ascending generation order
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if (minGeneration < 0 || maxGeneration < minGeneration)
